Choosing a Color Copier

June 24, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Why Choosing the Right Color Copier Matters

Whether you're a small business owner, office manager, or IT decision-maker, the right copier can:

  • Improve team productivity

  • Enhance the quality of printed materials

  • Save costs on outsourcing

  • Support workflow with scanning, email, and cloud storage

  • Reinforce your brand with sharp, full-color documents

Making the right choice from the start can prevent frustration and expensive mistakes later.

To explore business-specific scenarios, visit Selecting a Color Copier for Your Business Needs.

Key Factors to Consider When Choosing a Color Copier

Here are the top criteria to evaluate:

1. Monthly Print Volume

Ask yourself: how many pages does your team print per month?

  • Low volume: under 5,000 pages/month

  • Medium volume: 5,000–20,000 pages/month

  • High volume: 20,000+ pages/month

Choose a model rated for your monthly volume to avoid overuse, breakdowns, or performance slowdowns. Underestimating volume is one of the most common purchasing mistakes.

2. Print Speed

Measured in pages per minute (ppm), speed impacts productivity. For example:

  • 20–30 ppm: suitable for small teams

  • 31–50 ppm: ideal for mid-sized offices

  • 51+ ppm: best for high-demand environments like print shops or schools

Fast copiers reduce bottlenecks, especially in busy offices with multiple users.

Explore the fastest-performing units in Best Color Copier Models.

3. Print Resolution and Color Accuracy

Resolution is measured in DPI (dots per inch)—the higher the number, the crisper the image.

  • 600 x 600 DPI: basic office needs

  • 1200 x 1200 DPI or more: design, marketing, or client-facing materials

Some high-end copiers also feature color calibration tools and Pantone matching to maintain brand consistency across materials.

4. Functionality: Do You Need More Than Just Printing?

Many color copiers are multifunction printers (MFPs) with added capabilities:

  • Scanning to email or network

  • Copying and faxing

  • Secure printing with user authentication

  • Cloud storage and mobile printing

These added features help streamline daily workflows and reduce the need for multiple devices.

5. Paper Handling and Media Types

If your team prints on various paper sizes and weights, choose a copier that supports:

  • A4, A3, legal, and envelope sizes

  • Glossy, card stock, and thick media

  • Duplex (double-sided) printing

  • Multiple paper trays (to separate paper types or sizes)

Bypass trays are helpful for specialty media like letterheads or custom labels.

6. Ease of Use and Interface

Modern copiers often feature touchscreen panels with:

  • Customizable workflows

  • Print previews

  • Access to cloud services like Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive

  • Remote print from mobile devices

User-friendly interfaces help reduce training time and limit errors.

Color Copier Rental vs. Purchase

Should you rent or buy your copier?

Rental is ideal if:

  • You want to avoid a large upfront cost

  • You prefer all-inclusive service and maintenance

  • Your office needs may change in the next 1–3 years

  • You want the flexibility to upgrade models

Buying may suit you if:

  • You’re certain about long-term needs

  • You can manage maintenance and repairs in-house

  • Your print volume is low and consistent

Learn more about financial options in Color Copier Rental Costs.

Understanding Copier Maintenance

Even the best copier requires regular maintenance to ensure optimal performance. Look for a provider that offers:

  • Scheduled servicing

  • Replacement of toner and consumables

  • On-site support for breakdowns

  • Remote diagnostics and firmware updates

For a full breakdown of what's included, check out Maintenance of Color Copiers.

What’s in a Rental Agreement?

Before signing a copier rental agreement, review the details carefully. A good agreement should clearly define:

  • Monthly rental rates

  • Included services (toner, parts, technician visits)

  • Response time for repairs

  • Contract length and upgrade options

  • Overuse charges or page count limits

Understanding the terms helps you avoid hidden fees or service gaps. See more in Color Copier Rental Agreements.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Can I print high-resolution graphics with a color copier?
Yes! Many modern models are built for marketing and design professionals. Just ensure the copier has a resolution of 1200 DPI or higher and supports color management tools.

Q: What’s the average lifespan of a copier?
With proper maintenance, most office-grade copiers last 5 to 7 years. However, tech upgrades and usage levels may shorten this.

Q: Is leasing a copier better than buying?
Leasing or renting is often better for growing businesses or those wanting to avoid upfront capital costs and benefit from ongoing support.

Final Thoughts

Choosing a color copier doesn’t have to be overwhelming. By focusing on your team’s print volume, required features, and long-term goals, you can select a model that boosts productivity and saves money.

Whether you rent or buy, make sure to choose a provider that offers clear terms, responsive support, and the ability to scale with your needs.

Ready to choose the right color copier for your business?
